net.sf.opensftp
Interface SftpUtil

All Known Implementing Classes:
SftpUtil
public interface SftpUtil

SftpUtil provides a handy set of utilities designed to ease your work with SFTP.

Author:
BurningXFlame@gmail.com

connect

SftpSession connect(String host,
                    String user,
                    String identityFile,
                    int strictHostKeyChecking)
                    throws SftpException
Connects to an SFTP server at the default port(22) with publickey authentication with empty passphrase. This method is equivalent to: 
 connect(host, 22, user, "", identityFile, strictHostKeyChecking)

Returns:
an SftpSession object representing the context of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException
See Also:
connect(String, int, String, String, String, int, int)

connect

SftpSession connect(String host,
                    String user,
                    String passphrase,
                    String identityFile,
                    int strictHostKeyChecking)
                    throws SftpException
Connects to an SFTP server at the default port(22) with publickey authentication. This method is equivalent to: 
 connect(host, 22, user, passphrase, identityFile, strictHostKeyChecking)

Returns:
an SftpSession object representing the context of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException
See Also:
connect(String, int, String, String, String, int, int)

connect

SftpSession connect(String host,
                    int port,
                    String user,
                    String passphrase,
                    String identityFile,
                    int strictHostKeyChecking,
                    int timeout)
                    throws SftpException
Connects to an SFTP server with publickey authentication.

Parameters:
host - Host name
port - Port number
user - User name
passphrase - Passphrase. An empty string ("") indicates no passphrase.
identityFile - The path of the identityFile. For security, it's strongly recommended to place your identityFile in the .ssh folder under your home folder, /home/yourusername/.ssh for Linux for instance. If you specify a value begining with '~' and a following directory separator ('/' or '\\'), the '~' is treated as your home folder.
strictHostKeyChecking - The strictHostKeyChecking option. Valid values are STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_ASK, STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_YES and STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_NO.
timeout - the timeout in milliseconds. A timeout of zero is treated as an infinite timeout.
Returns:
an SftpSession object representing the context of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException

connectByPasswdAuth

SftpSession connectByPasswdAuth(String host,
                                String user,
                                String password,
                                int strictHostKeyChecking)
                                throws SftpException
Connects to an SFTP server at the default port(22) with password authentication. This method is equivalent to: 
 connectByPasswdAuth(host, 22, user, password, strictHostKeyChecking)

Returns:
an SftpSession object representing the context of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException
See Also:
connectByPasswdAuth(String, int, String, String, int, int)

connectByPasswdAuth

SftpSession connectByPasswdAuth(String host,
                                int port,
                                String user,
                                String password,
                                int strictHostKeyChecking,
                                int timeout)
                                throws SftpException
Connects to an SFTP server with password authentication.

Parameters:
host - Host name
port - Port number
user - User name
password - Password. An empty string ("") indicates no password.
strictHostKeyChecking - The strictHostKeyChecking option. Valid values are STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_ASK, STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_YES and STRICT_HOST_KEY_CHECKING_OPTION_NO.
timeout - the timeout in milliseconds. A timeout of zero is treated as an infinite timeout.
Returns:
an SftpSession object representing the context of the communication established between the client and the specified SFTP server.
Throws:
SftpException

disconnect

void disconnect(SftpSession session)
Disconnects from an SFTP server.

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.

ls

SftpResult ls(SftpSession session)
Represents the ls command. This method is equivalent to: 
 ls(session, ".")

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation. Invoking getExtension() on the returned SftpResult object should return a List<SftpFile> object, if this ls operation succeeds.
See Also:
ls(SftpSession, String)

ls

SftpResult ls(SftpSession session,
              String path)
Represents the ls command.

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
path - The path to be listed.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation. Invoking getExtension() on the returned SftpResult object should return a List<SftpFile> object, if this ls operation succeeds.

put

SftpResult put(SftpSession session,
               String localFilename)
Represents the put command. This method is equivalent to: 
 put(session, localFilename, ".")

See Also:
put(SftpSession, String, String)

put

SftpResult put(SftpSession session,
               String localFilename,
               String remoteFilename)
Represents the put command.

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
localFilename - The path of the local file to be uploaded.
remoteFilename - The remote path where to place the local file.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation

               String remoteFilename,
               String localFilename)

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
remoteFilename - The path of the remote file to be downloaded.
localFilename - The local path where to place the remote file.

an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation

pwd

SftpResult pwd(SftpSession session)
Represents the pwd command.

Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation. Invoking getExtension() on the returned SftpResult object should return a String object representing the current path, if this pwd operation succeeds.

Represents the lpwd command.

Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation. Invoking getExtension() on the returned SftpResult object should return a String object representing the current path, if this lpwd operation succeeds.

chgrp

SftpResult chgrp(SftpSession session,
                 int gid,
                 String path)
Represents the chgrp command.

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
gid - The GID of the new group
path - The path of the file or directory the group of which you want to change.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation

chown

SftpResult chown(SftpSession session,
                 int uid,
                 String path)
Represents the chown command.

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
uid - The UID of the new owner
path - The path of the file or directory the owner of which you want to change.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation

chmod

SftpResult chmod(SftpSession session,
                 int mode,
                 String path)
Represents the chmod command.

Parameters:
session - The SftpSession object you previously got when connecting.
mode - an three-digit octal number, 0755 for instance, representing the new permissions
path - The path of the file or directory the permission of which you want to change.
Returns:
an SftpResult object representing the result of this operation
